questions.question_text:
A company is implementing Dynamics 365 Supply Chain Management.

The company has a customer who is also a vendor. If the customer's address changes, the company must make a single change. The change must be reflected for both the customer and vendor records.

You need to configure the system for the customer and vendor address.

What should you do?

choices.D: Create a single contact that is shared between the customer and vendor records.
choices.B: Create separate party records for both the customer and vendor records.
choices.A: Create separate party records with a single relationship defined between them.
choices.C: Create a single party record linked to both the customer and vendor records.

discussion.content: Q2 must be Dynamics 365 Finance. In Dynamics 365, you can create security policies using the Dynamics 365 Finance application itself, specifically through the Security configuration workspace. Visual Studio, on the other hand, is primarily used for development and customization purposes in Dynamics 365. So, for creating security policies, you would typically use the Dynamics 365 Finance application rather than Visual Studio.

discussion.content:
Q1 Security policy
A Security Policy allows for record-level security.
Security roles are used to define a set of privileges and access levels for different areas of the system, but they are not granular enough to control access at the record level within a table

questions.question_text:
A company uses Dynamics 365 Finance for its global operations.

The company wants to restrict all users from uploading attachments to tables except for the vendor table.

You need to determine a solution.

Which configuration should you use?

comments.content:
I agree.
"On the Document management parameters page, on the General tab, you can use the Use active document tables option to enable the Active document tables allow list. If you set this option to Yes, you disable attachments on all other tables. Therefore, turn on this option only when it's required."
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/organization-administration/configure-document-management

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
Active document is correct answer. I verified in system.

Selected Answer: D
The correct answer is D. Configure security permissions for the target table.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/fin-ops-core/dev-itpro/organization-administration/configure-document-management

D. Configure security permissions for the target table.

By configuring security permissions, you can control access to specific tables. In this case, you would restrict access to the attachment feature for all tables except the vendor table. This ensures that users can only upload attachments to the vendor table and not to any other tables.

choices.B: Remove all document management file types.
choices.A: Remove all user access for the SharePoint document management location
choices.D: Configure security permissions for the target table.
